bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. PITTS:H.R. 1852.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following: Article I, Section 8, Clause 1: TheCongress shall have Power to lay and collect Taxes, Duties,Imposts and Excises, to pay the Debts and provide for thecommon Defense and general Welfare of the United States; butall Duties, Imposts and Excises shall be uniform throughoutthe United States.[Page H3220]

item.title: Children's Hospital GME Support Reauthorization Act of 2011

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 162.

item.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 175.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H6254)
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.(text: CR H6254)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1852.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H6254-6255)
Mr. Pitts moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 132.
Reported by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. H. Rept. 112-205.
Reported by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. H. Rept. 112-205.
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee .
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

summary.text: Children's Hospital GME Support Reauthorization Act of 2011 - Amends the Public Health Service Act to extend and reauthorize appropriations for payments to children's hospitals associated with operating approved graduate medical residency training programs.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Children's Hospital GME Support Reauthorization Act of 2011 - Amends the Public Health Service Act to extend and reauthorize appropriations for payments to children's hospitals associated with operating approved graduate medical residency training programs.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Children's Hospital GME Support Reauthorization Act of 2011 - Amends the Public Health Service Act to extend and reauthorize appropriations for payments to children's hospitals associated with operating approved graduate medical residency training programs.

item.titleType: Short Titles as Reported to House
item.title: Children's Hospital GME Support Reauthorization Act of 2011
To amend the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize support for graduate medical education programs in children's hospitals.

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 175.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
